description: Listed for sale is a 1983 Porsche 911 SC Cabriolet in terrific condition. This air cooled cabrio spent nearly all its life on the west coast and it shows! The car shows a clean and thorough carfax/autocheck, which is available upon request.
The vehicle is in terrific mechanical condition and similarly excellent cosmetic condition.

This is a matching numbers car. These later air cooled cars were galvanized and therefore, this 911 is unbelievably rust free. It has also been garaged since day 1 from my understanding. The car started its life briefly in Massachusetts and was in California and Utah from the late 80's until a few months ago.

The car has new oil tubes installed and fresh oil. Timing chain and tensioners were done about 10K miles ago. Lots of receipts over the years. I would drive this anywhere without any worries. Zero rust and the paint is clean and looks great.
Vehicle has power windows, power mirrors, power locks, power antenna, AM/FM CD. The interior seats have no rips or tears and the convertible top is nearly new.

This was the first year of production for the 911 Cabriolet and is therefore undoubtedly a terrific investment-grade and rare vehicle. Numerous magazines and scholarly sources list the 1983 Porsche 911 SC Cabriolet as a classic that will continue to increase in desirability.
Some of the many option codes listed for this car include:
018 Sports steering wheel with elevated hub 30 mm
020 Speedometer with two scales mph-km/h
158 Cassette-radio Blaupunkt Monterey
197 Stronger battery
395 16" Fuchs forged alloy wheels, front 6" with 205/55, rear 7" with 225/50 tyres
454 Automatic speed control
455 Wheel locks
484 USA symbols and lettering for switches and instruments
533 Alarm
566 Fog lamps
577 Heated windshield

This is a 1976 Porsche 911 coupe was restored in the 90's and took nearly 7 years to complete. The wide body flares that have been added to the car are steel welded flush and then leading was done to contour the flaring. The only fiberglass on the car is the whale tail in the rear and the front spoiler. The metal work was done by a professional body shop.
Serial number on the engine is *6119134*
The 2.7L was bored out and rebuilt at the time of the cars restoration
Stainless steel dual exhaust
6 singe barrel carbs, one for each cylinder
Add on cooling system that has a stainless vent stack under the spoiler
The wheels are BBS Wheels and the tires run 245/50ZR16 in the front and the rears are 255/50ZR16
4 wheel vented drilled disc brakes
Race suspension with dual sway bars
All the interior has been replaced over time and is in good condition.
The gauges are all custom painted white with black and they look great.
The seats are upgraded power seats from a 928 S4
New Optima battery
All bearings replaced on wheels and all joints were repacked
The car runs great and deserves to be driven.  It has the iconic wide body look and will draw attention wherever it goes.
1972 Porsche 914-6 GT
This race car features a solid chassis into which a modified six cylinder motor was installed.
The engine was built by Musante Motor Sports, CT. Estimated engine power is 230 HP and the car complies with all SVRA Group 8 regulations.
The engine is mated to a close ratio Porsche 915 gearbox built by G-Box.
48 mm PMO carbs fuel the engine with MSD ignition and a Mallory distributor.
Stainless BB headers
Weight of the car is 2029 lbs, ¼ tank and no driver.
Front brakes are vented discs with alloy calipers.  Rear brakes are steel. All brakes are Porsche with 930 Porsche axles.
The body features fiberglass hood, front fenders, rear flares, bumpers, front valance and rockers.
An 8 gallon ATL fuel cell is installed along with an Optima Group 34 battery.
The car is fitted with 7” front and 8” rear Fuchs wheels. A set of four spare 7”wheels come with the car. The original close ratio gearbox is also included, but needs rebuilding.
Interior includes full AutoMeter instrumentation.
Kirkey racing seat.
Fire suppression system

This car has been raced for the past 4/5 seasons and is fast and reliable. The car was built and has been serviced by the well respected Vintage Racing Services in Stratford, CT. This car is in excellent condition throughout and ready to race with minimum work required.
1987 Porsche 911 g50 3.2 sunroof coupe
Extremely rare Cassis exterior, Oxblood interior
Owned for eight years - bought and imported by me, from Seattle, Washington.
In excellent condition, Service records for many years
Major work performed by Turn 3 Autosports in past 2,000 miles ($11,000) :
Top End Rebuild
New Brakes
Upgraded Head Studs
New Motor Mounts
No accidents. Clean title.  One key scratch claim during my ownership, with Porsche paint specialist brought in to match.
No dealers, brokers, serious purchasers only please with name, email and phone number. No one else will receive a reply.
No test drives, purchase agreement can be contingent upon satisfactory pre- purchase inspection, which can be arranged at Turn 3, or another mutually agreeable Porsche specialty facility.
Car is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. Willing to accommodate shipping requests, with appropriate arrangements for payment that will provide mutual assurances.
Reason for selling - Due to health issues.
Carproof or Carfax can be obtained to confirm vehicle status - V.I.N. number will be supplied upon request.
Will consider trades for vacation condo property.

1972 914-6 Air-colled 2.2L 40mm weber carbs, Electronotive crankfire ignition, front oil cooler, sideshaft transmission, puck clutch, 911 vented discs, s/s brake lines, 19mm master, Delron bushings, fiberglass decks, weighs 1900 pounds, nine gallon fuel cell, five lug hubs, full cage, five-point harnesses, larg tach and camera mount,
Update!..Update!

This amazingly clean (CANADIAN) 1988 Porsche 911 Targa Carrera just had a recent full service done which included, New tires, new fuel lines and pump kit front to back, new front hood struts, A/C reseal and recharge, full tune up, lube oil and filter, brake adjustments and brake piston seals and full leak test that passed with flying colors!
All Porsche approve parts done by top Porsche mechanic in Ontario
This car is ready to roll with no headaches!
I have had it for approx 15 years and its time to let her go
It is a beautiful rare and hard to find Graphite color
5 spd G50 manual transmision with Targa top
Grey interior
It is all original except for the radio
This model has the large original Factory installed Whale Tail at the back above the smooth yet powerful 3.2 litre boxster engine
Always maintained with full documneted history from day one
I have all the documents and bills to prove
NO RUST
NO ACCIDENTS
NO BODY MODIFICATIONS
NO ENGINE MODIFICATIONS
NO CRACKED DASH
I have stamped delivery book and manuals from Heimrath Porsche
Original pump kit and tools
Original folding spare tire
I have a fitted car cover that is used all the time
This car was always stored indoors from fall to spring
A Very Clean car for its age and original condition!
Some minor wear and tear inside an out, but nothing that really stands out
I would rate this car ABOUT 8.5 /10
I would really love to sell this car to a true Porsche enthusiast and not a person who wants to convert it to a track machine. That would be a shame
Asking a fair market value of $67000 (CAD) or best reasonable offer!
NO TRADES PLEASE
......and no low ballers PLEASE!!!!
Im not desperate to sell and dont need the money.
This car will continue to become more valuable if kept in the same condition
I have MANY pictures but can only post s many here. I can send you more photos if interested
Carproof of this car is available!!
THIS IS A CANADIAN CAR.  ORIGINALLY LANDED, SOLD IN CANADA AND ALWAY HAS HAD CANADIAN OWNERSHIP
Please see www.pristineautosusa.com for more photos.

We are pleased to offer this very clean and well maintained 1984 porsche 911 Targa. The mileage is 133k which we guarantee. The exterior color is Chiffon White, the interior is Chocolate leather. This Porsche has always lived in California's dry climate, and it shows by how clean the car is both inside and out. Mostly original paint, all original body panels. Original carpets, non cracked dash. 7 and 8in wheels. Just had engine out service, new clutch, drives great. Good compression, smooth transmission. This Porsche does everything it should the right way.
To view or test drive this Porsche 911 Targa or ask question, please call 805-929-4444. We are located in Nipomo on the sunny Central Coast of California. We will assist with shipping. Thank you

Super original - survivor condition - 911SC Targa in beautiful and seldom seen Casablanca Beige Metallic with contrasting Brown leather interior. No accidents or paintwork and only 74K original miles! We Just Finish a Full Engine Service, including valves, Camshafts, gaskets, guides, piston rings and A/C. Always covered in climate controlled storage and maintained to a high standard with a few upgrades: PMO carbs,Full Targa Top, ... very quick and great sounding flat 6!!! Priced at $36,990.00 OBO. Call or text me with questions or to view in Winter Park, where vehicle is stored. We Have Certificate of Authenticity, Tools, Owners Manual and folding Targa Top.We also just installed Brand New Rims & Tires.
Have you heard, brown is the new black?
Up for sale is this very cool, mostly unrestored 1978 Porsche 911SC sunroof coupe finished in its rare and original Bitter Chocolate exterior and Cork interior.

I bought this car earlier this year from a friend needing working capital to launch a new business venture. He purchased it some years ago from Vertex Auto in Miami, Florida, a well-respected dealer in pre-owned Porsche cars, replacement parts and accessories. Unfortunately other than showing up as a Florida car in the 911 registry there are scant records my friend had other than a list of modifications made by Vertex.

The chassis is rolling on 137k+ miles and as is very common on these cars the odometer has recently quit. But not to worry, as the mechanicals show to have been thoroughly gone through with a rebuild reported within the last 5 years and 10.000 miles. In addition to installing Turbo brakes, short throw shift kit, larger Fuchs style wheels, fresh Hankook rubber and a new steering rack, the motor was warmed over with a 964 cam grind, Dansk exhaust and K and N intake filter. 930 Turbo brakes. Updated Carrera chain tensioners, airbox pop off valve and head studs were also installed.

I have owned nine air cooled Porsches and do much of the wrenching at my own shop. I am especially familiar with these 3.0 911SC models. As such you can trust me when I say this is a very quick and strong running 3.0. It doesn't leak or smoke. The lowered stance delivers a firm ride. The car tracks straight down the road and the big Turbo brakes haul it down with authority. Handling is what you would expect from an air cooled Porsche, pretty much spot on. The Dansk exhaust gives the car a raucous idle and a mechanical growl only an air cooled flat six can produce.

The original cork interior was reupholstered and shows very well. The door panels and pockets are in great condition. The headliner is taught, original carpet in great shape. A nice set of quality coco mats add a touch of period correct class. An aftermarket Momo style steering wheel is installed. The original dash is capped but looks good and is hardly a detraction. The car also benefits from a more modern 964 AC system upgrade. The heat and defrost work as do all of the instruments, instrument lights and courtesy lights. Windows and sunroof operate as they should. Door pulls and locks in perfect working order. Being my friend is involved in the Miami music scene, he equipped the car with a killer sound system that includes a Blaupunkt head unit, and a powered sub woofer under the seat.

I had intentions to invest in the body cosmetics but instead find myself driving it as often as possible. Porsche people encourage me to leave it alone and I too have come to find its patina charming. Besides its cheaper and more fun to just be on the hunt for cool stickers worthy of the rear quarter windows.

To clarify, there is no rust on this car, there are a few paint imperfections, minor dings and chips but the car has never been hit and all panels are believed original. I have not purchased a Certificate of Authenticity from Porsche but the motor is correct for the model year and I have no reason to suspect that it or the 915 5-speed gearbox is not original to the car.

Who needs a certificate from Porsche anyway? I can personally guarantee that this car is authentically cool. This car is part of the new breed of Porsche outlaws, an irreverent group of air cooled 911 enthusiasts who care more about how their car runs than looks. It will serve its new owner well, whether looking for a reliable daily driver that can be taken out in any weather condition, parked anywhere without the fear of marring a perfect paint job and taken to the track for a good thrashing. One that is known to let their dog ride along or go months without washing it and still get thumbs up from the Porsche club guys at the cars and coffee while enjoying his or her Bitter Chocolate mocha Grande.

This car is located in Rockwall, Texas. Offered and sold as is where is. Texas residents may be subject to sales tax and fees. More photos available upon request. If you are reading this, the car is still for sale. Yes it is a relist. My buddy couldn't swing the buy back. Sorry no service records, please don't ask. Pre purchase inspections welcome and encouraged. Scammers and sales assistants need not apply. Call, text or reply. Peace.
1986.5 928S 5 Speed Grand Tour Coupe
Factory 32 Valve engine , S4 suspension and factory brembo brakes
Factory Original Paint Guards Red Matching number car!
We are pleased to offer this excellent original example of a well cared for exceptionally well maintained Ultra rare 928 5 speed mid year 32 VALVE.
This vehicle spent the majority of it's life in in a temp controlled garage in Illinois. The car has been well cared for.

The Mechanicals on this 928 are all in great condition including engine and transmission. No funny noises coming out of the super tight engine, runs cool and quiet. No leaks at all,The undercarriage is dry and clean and rust free as shown in pics. Wheels and tires are nice, no scratches on the rims I personally have put several hundred miles on this car, you can drive this car comfortably in regular modern traffic with ease, The car handles remarkably well for it's age, takes corners well and is a joy to drive.
We have brand new Pirelli tires that will be installed prior to delivery for new owner
working ice cold A/c,
Timing belt service done including fuel line replacement
suspension gone through, handles remarkably well
properly working sunroof and power windows

Interior is in exceptional condition all original seats, Dash is super nice all other panels are super clean and straight including a pristine headliner, very nice door panels and very clean and nice rear interior panels
Paint is in very nice condition, it has beautiful depth and shine, zero dents or dings, presents extremely well.
This car has less than 67k original mileage. There are no stories with this car,
We have recently completed a service on the car,
-changed fluids
-replaced fuel lines 30R9 w/stainless steel clamps
-A/C service
-intake gasket and vacum lines replaced
-injector seals
-spark plugs, distributor caps and rotors
-checked and replaced all worn or non working bulbs
-All lights, wipers, windows, sunroof ,switches, relays checked and replaced if necessary
-confirmed belt service and condition, belt recently replaced and in mint condition
-New Pirelli Tires
Please call for more details 312 884 1 1 7 4

1983 Porsche 911SC Targa,  With only three owners since new this is a survivor car in excellent original condition. Only 74,000 miles (the speedometer was repaired in 2004 at 67,814 and is documented, which is why the odometer shows 6,193). We have owned the car for the past 5 years, it has had top notch service. New coil and alternator, distributor cap and wire package, and more. Paint shows beautifully with the expected wear in a few places. A tiny bit of surface rust shows though at the front bumper. 5 speed manual transmission, good brakes and tires. Interior is very good with the usual wear but no splts or rips in the leather. Dash is perfect, carpet is good, power windows and mirrors work well. This car might not be concourse perfect, but it isn't far from that. Restore or simply enjoy it as a fun but sound investment.
2.2L Porsche 914-6 with 10hrs on rebuilt engine. 45mm weber carb's, 901 close ratio gearbox, aluminum calipers. Tested, tuned and ready for the next SVRA group 8 race.

The Porsche 928 luxury sports coupe was a success right from its introduction and has the distinction of being the company's first production V8 powered model as well as the only coupe powered by a front-mounted V8 engine. Originally intended to replace the company's iconic 911, the 928 combined the power, poise, and handling of a sports car with the refinement, comfort, and equipment of a luxury saloon. Porsche executives believed such a flagship would have wider appeal than the compact, quirky and sometimes difficult 911. Each model year the 928 would introduce new advancements to stay ahead of the competition. The 1985 model brought a new S variant featuring a 5.0 liter 32-valve V8 engine that produced a healthy 288 horsepower and was equipped with the smooth-running Bosch LH-Jetronic fuel injection. This all black 928 S was produced with the rare BorgWarner synchromesh 5-speed manual transmission. It is believed that less than 20% of all 928s' were optioned with the sporty manual transmission. Power assisted rack and pinion steering point the 928 in all the right directions and the four-wheel disc brakes bring things to a controlled halt. Standard to typical Porsche performance is Porsche luxury. This 928 S has a long list of comfort and convenience features like power sunroof, leather interior, air conditioning, power bucket seats, power windows and cruise control just to name a few. With less than 64K original miles on the odometer this sports coupe has just received a full bumper-to-bumper service and is ready to be enjoyed. Stock Number: HC6677 VIN: WP0JB0923FS861091 Miles: 63,600 Actual miles (miles marked actual on title) 63,869 miles showing on the odometer Engine: Numbers Matching 302 CI V8 with 288 Horsepower Engine Stamp Pad: M28 43 81F00429 Transmission: 5-Speed Manual Trim Tag: 0285 (February 1985, Stuttgart, Germany) Equipment: 32 Valve V8, Bosch Jetronic Fuel Injection, Power Rack and Pinion Steering, Four-Wheel Disc Brakes, Leather Interior, Air Conditioning, Power Sunroof, VDO Gauges, Power Windows, Power Mirrors, Eight-Way Power Bucket Seats, Cruise Control, Rear Defroster, Power Retractable Headlamps, Headlamp Washers, Rear Spoiler, Rear Wiper, Kenwood CD Stereo, JBL Speakers, Side Protection Moldings Items Included with the Car: Original Owner's Manual, Original Maintenance Booklet Condition Code: (3) * (see condition code chart for explanation of category codes 1-5) Warranty: This vehicle is being sold AS-IS To learn more about condition codes, the term numbers matching, conditions of sale, and Hendrick Performance, please see the bottom of this page for details and clarification. - Contact Sales Team at 704-453-2140 or

The body of the vehicle was rust free before I restored it. The vehicle was taken right down to the shell to start the process, no corners were cut! (I have photo's during the process) The car runs great and is a great car to take out on a sunny day, it turns heads every time i drive it.

Up for sale this week at Canyon State Classics is this 68,000 Original mile Beauty!! 1986 Porsche 911 Carrera Coupe equipped with a 915 5 Speed Manual  transmission and the bulletproof 3.2L Flat 6 engine. This fully documented, 3 owner CA-AZ 911 shows beautifully in Black on Tan leather. This car came from the factory with all the options a true 911 driver would want- and its been treated the right way! A stacked service history including the factory recommended intervals at 30k and 60k have been done, as well as all the other little stuff in between. This coupe is equipped with the Blaupunkt Las Vegas CD Player and sits on Michelin wrapped 7's & 8's Fuch wheels. You cant ask for a much better Carrera Coupe!

This beautiful 911 was purchased new on October 14th, 1986 at Rector Motor Car Company in Burlingame CA. Just a year later, on July 12, 1987, it was sold to its second owner at Falore Eurosport where it went on to live in San Mateo, CA until late 1999 when it changed hands again. From there the car traveled to Half Moon Bay, CA where it served under its third owner and then into Arizona where its third owner has kept the car since the mid-early 2000's. This coupe features extensive ownership and maintenance history that well documents miles and repairs throughout the life of the car.
The following is a list of options as this 911 is currently equipped:

- 3.2L 207hp 6-Cyl M930/21 - 5-Speed Manual Transmission G915/73 - 4 Wheel Disc Brakes - Electric Sliding Sunroof - Air Conditioned Climate Control - Cruise Control - Blaupunkt Las Vegas CD Head Unit - Alarm System - Central Locking System - Power Windows
Extra Factory Options
- Steering Wheel w/ Raised hub - Sport Shock Absorbers - Shortened Shift Lever travel - Forged Alloy Wheels - Fuchs 16'' - Sport Tire Selection

This Porsche's classic factory Black paint is gorgeous and was just fully buffed and  hand waxed. The body on the car has only very minimal  signs of wear and a few chips here and there that have been touched up.  The car is arrow straight and is Carfax and Autocheck certified to have never been in an accident. This 911 has always been  garage kept and pampered its entire life and really shows. I have had the car up in the air and have fully inspected for rust of any kind, and it was clear that this car has always lived in a corrosion free environment, but also always garaged because the interior is so dang nice! Lower fenders, rockers, belly pan, and spare tire area are perfect with zero rust of any kind. I put my 15+ years in the classic car business behind my inspection.
The car is riding on 16'' Staggered light alloy wheels with black centers. They are all in like new condition and wrapped in OEM spec correct Michelin Sport All Season performance radials.

The beautiful Tan leather interior is all original and looks great. The dash is perfect with no cracks, door panels are very clean. Everything works in the car.. lights, gauges, radio, seats, windows, locks, a/c blows ice cold, etc.

Mechanically, this Porsche is in great condition and runs and drives great. It has very healthy and very quick 3.2L. This car boasts 207 bhp and flys 0-60 in 6.3 sec with a top speed of 160mph!  The car has a very strong 5-Speed  transmission that shifts perfect with fresh clutch recently installed. The car has just been serviced at a Porsche Only service center with Mobil 1 and was given a clean  bill of health. The motor is very tight, and doesn't leak at all, which is rare  for these cars. This car is very clean under the hood and really shows how its previous owner took excellent care of it. The A/C blows ice cold and the heat works as it should.

This car has been well looked after for all of its life. Most notable of the extensive service records are the 30k and 60k services which were done on time! The original selling dealer of this 911 (Rector Motor Car Company) did the 30k service on Feb 20th, 1992 by the second owner. At the beginning of the 3rd owner's ownership of this car, he spent nearly $4,000 in service on the car at German Auto Kraft (at 52.5k miles) including a clutch overhaul, brake service, ac system overhaul, camshaft oil lines, as well as a rear crankshaft seal. A year later, the black coupe was back for its 60k service for the recommended items as well as a transmission service, oil line replacement, new distributor and 02 sensor as well as all-new oem shock absorbers. Since the third owner has moved the car out to Arizona, it has been under the watchful eyes of Stuttgart Southwest. Over the past decade they have maintained the coupe for all of its needs from the major service and valve cover resurface (at 64.7k miles) to hood struts and steering wheel adjustments. The 911 was most recently there last month for an oil change as well as a couple leaky diverter oil lines.

This car is ready to go! The exterior of this Coupe is stunning with special leather interior and is definitely a great color combination for the 911. This car is an excellent value and is a lot of car for the money, and with these low miles...you cant go wrong! This car has a clean Arizona title and clean Carfax and Autocheck. If you have any additional questions please call Jon at 480-703-2337. The car is located in beautiful sunny Tempe, AZ. Please email or call with any questions and I welcome international bidders! I can also help with shipping quotes and arrangements. We ship cars all over the world!
